required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Secukinumab on Radiographic Progression in Ankylosing Spondylitis as Compared to GP2017 (Adalimumab Biosimilar)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Partially-blinded Study of Secukinumab to Demonstrate Reduction of Radiographic Progression Versus GP2017 (Adalimumab Biosimilar) at 104 Weeks and to Assess the Long Term Safety, Tolerability and Efficacy up to 2 Years in Patients With Active Ankylosing Spondylitis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to demonstrate the impact of secukinumab on progression of structural damage in the spine, as measured by the mSASSS in patients with AS.

study_design_info.masking_description: The Participant, Care Provider, Investigator and Sponsor are blinded to Secukinumab dose

primary_outcome.measure: No radiographic progression as measured by modified Stoke Ankylosing Spondylitis Spine Score (mSASSS)
primary_outcome.description: To demonstrate the proportion of subjects on secukinumab (150 mg s.c. or 300 mg s.c.) with no radiographic progression as measured by mSASSS at Week 104 is superior to subjects on GP2017 (adalimumab biosimilar 40 mg s.c.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in modified Stoke Ankylosing Spondylitis Spine Score (mSASSS)
secondary_outcome.description: To demonstrate the change from baseline in mSASSS in subjects on secukinumab (150 mg s.c. or 300 mg s.c.) is superior to GP2017 (adalimumab biosimilar 40 mg s.c.) at Week 104

secondary_outcome.measure: No new syndesmophytes as measured by mSASSS
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects with no new syndesmophytes is defined as the number of patients with a syndesmophyte at baseline who develops one by week 104, as measured by mSASSS
ASAS20 response is defined as an improvement of ≥20% and ≥1 unit on a scale of 10 in at least three of the four ASAS main domains and no worsening of ≥20% and ≥1 unit in the remaining domain
ASAS40 response is defined as an improvement of ≥40% and ≥2 units on a scale of 10 in at least three of the four ASAS main domains and no worsening at all in the remaining domain
ASAS partial remission is defined as a value not above 2 units in each of four main domains on a scale of 0 to 10

secondary_outcome.measure: Ankylosing Spondylitis Disease Activity Score (ASDAS) inactive disease
secondary_outcome.description: An ASDAS inactive disease response is a score of <1.3 on a composite index to assess disease activity in Ankylosing Spondylitis. Parameters include spinal pain, the patient's global assessment of disease activity, peripheral pain/swelling, duration of morning stiffness and C-reactive protein (CRP) in mg/L.
To evaluate the Berlin SI joint edema score in subjects on secukinumab (150 mg s.c. or 300 mg s.c.) at Week 104 versus GP2017 (adalimumab biosimilar 40 mg s.c.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Ankylosing Spondylitis Spine Magnetic Resonance Imaging - activity (ASspiMRI-a) Berlin modification score
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the ASspiMRI-a Berlin modification score in subjects on secukinumab (150 mg s.c. or 300 mg s.c.) at Week 104 versus GP2017 (adalimumab biosimilar 40 mg s.c.)

arm_group.description: Secukinumab 150 mg will be administered at Baseline, Weeks 1, 2, 3 and 4, followed by dosing every 4 weeks until Week 100
Secukinumab 300 mg will be administered at Baseline, Weeks 1, 2, 3 and 4, followed by dosing every 4 weeks until Week 100
GP2017 (adalimumab biosimilar) 40 mg will be administered at Baseline followed by dosing every 2 weeks until Week 102

intervention.description: Eligible subjects are randomized to one of three treatment arms in a 1:1:1 ratio
Eligible subjects are randomized to one of three treatment arms in a 1:1:1 ratio

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or non-pregnant, non-nursing female patients at least 18 years of age
- Diagnosis of moderate to severe Ankylosing Spondylitis with radiologic evidence (centrally read X-ray) fulfilling the Modified New York criteria for AS despite previous or current NSAID/ nonbiologic DMARD therapy
- Active AS assessed by total BASDAI ≥ 4 on a scale of 0-10
- Spinal pain as measured by BASDAI question #2 ≥ 4 (0-10)
- Total back pain as measured by visual analog scale (VAS) ≥ 40 mm (0-100 mm)
- hsCRP ≥ 5 mg/L OR presence of at least 1 syndesmophyte on centrally read spinal X-ray
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with total ankylosis of the spine
- Pregnant or nursing (lactating) women
- Evidence of ongoing infectious or malignant process
- Previous exposure to any biologic immunomodulating agent, including those targeting IL-17, IL-17 receptor or TNFα
- Subjects taking high potency opioid analgesics
- Previous treatment with any cell-depleting therapies including but not limited to anti-CD20, investigational agents
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply

clinical_study.keyword: ankylosing spondylitis, AS, secukinumab, GP2017, adalimumab biosimilar, mSASSS, ASAS20

patient_data.ipd_description: Novartis is committed to sharing with qualified external researchers, access to patient-level data and supporting clinical documents from eligible studies. These requests are reviewed and approved by an independent review panel on the basis of scientific merit. All data provided is anonymized to respect the privacy of patients who have participated in the trial in line with applicable laws and regulations. This trial data availability is according to the criteria and process described on www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com
